results.title: A New Deal?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rich World Poor World”.
About 10000 people around the world die every day from lack of food. Are we really heading for global disaster? What can the world do to help itself? This and other questions about world poverty are discussed

results.title: Business as Usual
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rich World Poor World”.
This program examines business ties between the wealthy North and destitute South. Brazil and Tanzania are featured in this episode

results.title: The Bottom Rung
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rich World Poor World”.
This program reports from Bangladesh, Tanzania and Brazil and highlights the extreme poverty there. It poses the question ‘Can the gap between rich world and poor world ever be closed?’

results.title: A New art in cooking
results.creator_credit: Jerry Warner and Lawry's Food Inc
results.brief_description: Every woman, no matter why her culinary talents, can produce unique and exciting cooking masterpieces in her own kitchen through the artistry of seasoning blends/ Employing works of master painters to introduce this concept, the film demonstrates the ease with which readily available seasoning ingredients can be used to add zest and variety to every meal. In addition, imaginative table settings provide new ideas.

results.title: A Natural question
results.creator_credit: Stan Gomm and Central Electricity Generating Board Film Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with the liaison between the sponsor and nature conservationists; showing some of the special nature trails they have set up for children in industrialised areas and describing other ways in which they are contributing towards nature conservancy. Presented by Phil Drabble with Art Direction by Richard Piper.

results.title: A Natural history of a psychotic illness in childhood
results.brief_description: Documented case from infancy onward. A chain of accidental circumstances provide a unique opportunity to obtain a visualised record of the gradual unfolding of the psychotic process in childhood. Contains material from three excellent sources, a family album of still photographs that tell the change in a series of static steps, a motion picture, filling in the gap between the stills with greater dynamic effect and a detailed and strangely objective diary kept by the mother. Research directed by James Anthony.

results.brief_description: The Emerson Mountaineers sing: “Seven years with the wrong women”; “Li’l Liza Jane”; and Johnny Long and his Orchestra present “In a shanty in old shanty town”.

results.title: A Moon mask by Freda Deising
results.creator_credit: Geoff Voyce, B T Film-Sound and North American Indian Films
results.brief_description: Freda Deising, a Haida Indian of the Eagle clan, is an outstanding artist of the North West Coast. For this film she carves a beautiful moon mask from alder and decorates the mask with abalone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoff Voyce, B T Film-Sound and North American Indian Films

results.title: A Moment's silence
results.brief_description:
“A Moment’s Silence” is a short film which explores the rhythm of the city of Amsterdam, but in a way that side-steps the familiar representation of a metropolis as a place where speed, power and progress converge.

Van Der Keuken’s camera shows us a major intersection drawing to a halt; cars and pedestrians wait in eerie silence in respect of some civic memorial. The soundtrack is bare of narration; not knowing the details, we can only observe the form.

From this quiet moment we move into the back streets and canals to witness a series of everyday events portrayed in a halting stop-start rhythm, where simple observation is combined with the use of repetition and jump cut editing.

Children play on rubbish skips, workmen clear a building site, and a man builds a fire out of junk with the canal lapping at his feet. These small events on the edges of the city’s life are brought momentarily to centre stage in this brief, poetic film.
